exceptions.exn: In environment x : Z H : 0 < - x Unable to unify "(1 ?= ?M1411) = Lt" with "(x ?= 0) = Lt".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x : Z, 0 < Z.opp x -> x < 0

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
Z.rem_bound_pos_pos : forall x y : Z, 0 < y -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= Z.rem x y < y
Z.rem_bound_neg_pos : forall x y : Z, y < 0 -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= Z.rem x y < - y
Z.rem_bound_pos_neg : forall x y : Z, 0 < y -> x <= 0 -> - y < Z.rem x y <= 0
ZMicromega.le_neg : forall x : Z, (0 <= x -> False) < -> 0 < - x
ZMicromega.lt_le_iff : forall x : Z, 0 < x < -> 0 <= x - 1
Zle_pos_neg : forall x : Z, 0 <= - x -> x <= 0
OMEGA8 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> x = - y -> x = 0
OMEGA2 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x + y
Zeq_bool_eq : forall x y : Z, Zeq_bool x y = true -> x = y
ZMicromega.le_0_iff : forall x y : Z, x <= y < -> 0 <= y - x
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
ZifyClasses.mkuspec : forall (S T : Type) (Op : T -> T) (I : ZifyClasses.InjTyp S T) (UPred : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, UPred x (Op x)) -> ZifyClasses.UnOpSpec Op
id_phi_N = fun x : N => x : N -> N Arguments id_phi_N _%N_scope
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : Z => x + 1 : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pred = fun x : Z => x + -1 : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pred _%Z_scope
IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (IDphi (R:=R))
fast_OMEGA13 : forall (v l1 l2 : Z) (x : positive) (P : Z -> Prop), P (l1 + l2) -> P (v * Z.pos x + l1 + (v * Z.neg x + l2))
fast_Zred_factor0 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * 1) -> P x
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Zmult_lt_0_reg_r : forall n m : Z, 0 < n -> 0 < m * n -> 0 < m
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x0 => Z.neg x0 | Z.neg x0 => Z.pos x0 end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.opp _%Z_scope
fast_Zopp_plus_distr : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (- x + - y) -> P (- (x + y))
Z.lt_1_l : forall n m : Z, 0 < n -> n < m -> 1 < m

Z.lt_m1_r : forall n m : Z, n < m -> m < 0 -> n < - (1)

Z.div_lt : forall a b : Z, 0 < a -> 1 < b -> a / b < a

Z.mul_pos_cancel_r : forall n m : Z, 0 < m -> 0 < n * m < -> 0 < n
Z.add_pos_cases : forall n m : Z, 0 < n + m -> 0 < n \/ 0 < m
Z.add_neg_cases : forall n m : Z, n + m < 0 -> n < 0 \/ m < 0
